If you need space for a group this is it in Salina. Plenty of room for a group of 8.
This is an older house but you wouldn’t know it once you are in. Only cons are you must walk upstairs to the bedrooms and the 6:15am trash truck that picks up at the hotel down the street (Pamela can’t control that)
Now the good news- one of the best places we have ever stayed. For the price all guests get what they need- lots of towels, many chairs outside, grill, crock pot, excellent cooking supplies, big family room plus a coupe of tables inside to do what you need.
Pamela had a large selection of snacks ready plus numerous bottles of water and water filter pouring jugs (Salina tap water tastes different). Great stove and powerful microwave. Cooking supplies and a stocked pantry with aluminum foil and plastic bags. Plenty of parking on both sides of house. Keyless entry was easy. We didn’t use everything in the house but there are extra outdoor folding chairs, chairs on the porch, fire pit, plus outdoor table with six chairs. Location is great you can walk to restaurants, bars, a live theater (music and performing), plus downtown Salina businesses.
Pamela will communicate with you and replies back instantly if needed.
All in all a great stay. Thanks Pamela. Will stay again if in Salina.
